item.title: After Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom, It's Time for Grezzo to Try Its Hand at Another Remake
item.description:
Grezzo's The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom is certainly one of the boldest steps forward for the franchise, finally putting players in the shoes of Princess Zelda by making her the lead protagonist and building on the creative foundations established by its predecessor, Tears of the Kingdom . However, despite the strides it takes toward innovation for the series, it also circles back to the past in one major way. Specifically, Echoes of Wisdom 's version of Hyrule bears a striking resemblance to the overworld from A Link to the Past , almost to the point of being identical in some ways. With that, the franchise might be setup for another remake, with Grezzo at the helm.

If Grezzo has proven anything, it's that it has a knack for Zelda remakes and remasters. While Echoes of Wisdom isn't a remake, it still feels like the bridge toward what could be one of the most requested remakes alongside Ocarina of Time : A Link to the Past . If nothing else, Grezzo's success with its fairly recent remake of Link's Awakening is a telling sign of what the developer is capable of, and with Echoes of Wisdom channeling the spirit of A Link to the Past in its version of Hyrule, the work feels almost halfway done already.

After Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom, It's Time for Grezzo to Revisit A Link to the Past

The Overlap Between Echoes of Wisdom and A Link to the Past Offers a Compelling Route Forward

To this day, A Link to the Past has been widely recognized as one of the most beloved and influential Zelda titles ever made. Released in 1991 for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System, it was a major leap forward for the series, introducing elements to the series that are still used today, like multi-layered dungeons, items that unlock overworld secrets, and the dual-world mechanic that even Echoes of Wisdom 's Still World is the fruit of. This is actually at least partly why Echoes of Wisdom resembles A Link to the Past so much, as Grezzo intentionally designed it to have that classic Zelda feel, and A Link to the Past is one of the best examples of that.

While Echoes of Wisdom isn't a remake, it still feels like the bridge toward what could be one of the most requested remakes alongside Ocarina of Time : A Link to the Past .

That's not all, though, as the layout of Echoes of Wisdom 's map bears a strong resemblance to A Link to the Past 's Hyrule, so much so that it wouldn't be at all surprising if Grezzo eventually announced it was developing a remake of the 1991 Zelda adventure. With Echoes of Wisdom serving as a soft reintroduction of sorts to that design philosophy, a remake of A Link to the Past would thus feel more like natural progress than a reset.

Grezzo Has Proven It Can Modernize Zelda Without Losing Its Soul

Perhaps even more than what it has accomplished with Echoes of Wisdom 's Hyrule, however, Grezzo has proven its ability to modernize Zelda without losing its soul. Not only is the Link's Awakening remake proof of this, but the fact that Echoes of Wisdom feels like a brand-new Zelda experience and yet is still rooted in a legacy that is now over three decades old is evidence of Grezzo's skill for remakes. Plus, given the developer's history of regularly intervening in the franchise with various remakes and remasters, throwing a Link to the Past remake in the mix wouldn't feel random or out of place at all.

In addition to the Link's Awakening remake, Grezzo was responsible for Zelda remasters like Ocarina of Time 3D , Majora's Mask 3D , and Zelda: Four Swords Anniversary Edition .

With Echoes of Wisdom renewing interest in classic Zelda design, there may never be a better time to revisit the world that first defined it. Grezzo already has a proven track record of remaining faithful to the series' roots while simultaneously modernizing them, and A Link to the Past is one of the few remaining titles that could benefit from that approach. All that's needed now is the green light.

item.title: RimWorld Odyssey: How to Get and Build a Gravship
item.description:
The RimWorld DLC, Odyssey , introduced one of the most enjoyable mechanics in the game so far, giving players the ability to build their own ships, called Gravships, to travel across the map. Through this vehicle, pawns can also visit new biomes and locations that were previously inaccessible, such as the planet’s orbit where the game unfolds, further expanding what can be accomplished.

Although colonists can start with a Gravship by default when selecting the scenario added with the DLC Odyssey , they can also create a new one later, letting any colony gain access to this item. So, for those unsure how to build a Gravship in RimWorld — or when it’s the best time to do so — this guide offers everything needed to get started.

How to Get a Gravship in RimWorld

The easiest way to obtain this craft in RimWorld is through the scenario introduced in the DLC Odyssey , The Gravship, which grants technology and items to the characters and sends players running from several mechanoids. For anyone unfamiliar with the game’s mechanics, this challenging start can make surviving the first few in-game hours considerably more difficult than one might expect.

At the same time, it lets players experience the mechanics added by the RimWorld DLC right away, without other preparations or building a Gravship from scratch, a process that can take some time before the vessel lifts off from the initial colony. Thus, it serves as an interesting alternative while adding another layer of challenge, chiefly because mechanoids are tough opponents .

How to Build a Gravship in RimWorld

Players who want to build a Gravship from scratch in RimWorld , using only the resources and tech available in their starting colony, can absolutely do so in the Odyssey DLC. After a few in-game days, once the pawns are settled, a new quest will appear called Mechanoid Signal . Accepting this quest is the first step in constructing a Gravship for the colony.

The Mechanoid Signal is a quest that does not have a deadline , so players are free to complete it whenever they choose.

Once accepted, the Grav Engine , a crucial component for building the ship, will spawn somewhere on the map, along with mechanoid troops, scrap chunks, and limited resources like Gravlite Panels. These are essential for construction, so players must secure the site. Selecting a pawn to investigate the Grav Engine completes this stage and unlocks the next phase.

After interacting with the engine, a new option becomes available in the Research Table: Basic Gravitech . This research unlocks the core components required to build a Gravship. However, it has a technology prerequisite (Electricity), which may not be available, depending on the starting scenario that you choose. If that’s the case, players will need to unlock that technology first.

Completing the Basic Gravitech research unlocks the following items needed for a functional Gravship:

  • Grav Anchor
  • Grav Field Extender
  • Gravship Hull
  • Pilot Console
  • Small Chamfuel Tank
  • Small Thruster

While RimWorld: Odyssey introduces many new components and other items to build, only a few are truly required to get a Gravship airborne : the Thruster, Fuel Tank, and Pilot Console. Once players finish the Basic Gravitech research, they can start building the ship by placing Gravship Substructure tiles, which serve as the base for other structures. Each tile costs 1x Gravlite Panel and 4x Steel, so resource planning is important.

Although not mandatory for flight, researching Biofuel Refining is strongly recommended . The ship’s Fuel Tank runs on Chemfuel, and one of the most efficient ways to produce it is by refining raw materials such as wood or plants, which can be easily found in several biomes across the colony map.

Once the Thruster, Fuel Tank, Pilot Console, and Substructure have been placed around the Grav Engine, players can interact with the console to initiate flight. In the beginning, due to the limited fuel capacity, the ship can only travel a few hexes at a time. Still, this early mobility is perfect for colonies looking to adopt a nomadic lifestyle, opening up new opportunities for exploration, resource gathering, and temporary settlements across the world map.

How to Get Gravlite Panels in RimWorld

Gravlite Panels are arguably one of the most important resources introduced in RimWorld: Odyssey , especially for players aiming to build their own Gravships. These items function as special floor tiles, and without them, players cannot expand the ship’s structure, making early travel limited and forcing tight space management during initial flights.

Fortunately, it’s possible to obtain this resource through colony quests . After accepting the Mechanoid Signal mission, Gravlite Panels begin appearing as rewards in many quest events. This provides a steady, if sometimes limited, supply to help expand the ship without relying solely on research. Additionally, it’s also possible to craft Gravlite Panels, but doing so requires players to unlock Advanced Grav Tech , a late-game research that can take a considerable amount of time and effort. Because of this, focusing on completing quests is usually the best way to obtain Gravlite Panels in the early and mid-game.

When Should You Build a Gravship in RimWorld?

There’s no single right answer to when a Gravship should be built in RimWorld: Odyssey . Although the Mechanoid Signal quest becomes available fairly early, that doesn’t mean it must be completed right away. Even if building the ship doesn’t require an overwhelming amount of materials, the game’s unpredictable nature means it’s crucial to have solid stockpiles , especially of Steel, before starting the project.

In the early stages, space for building is also limited. A good strategy for players looking to build a Gravship is to first unlock Complex Furniture , allowing the construction of Shelves . These help organize stockpiles more efficiently aboard the ship, freeing up space for vital utilities like beds or workstations.

Another factor to consider is the ship’s intended purpose. If the colony is adopting a nomadic lifestyle focused on ground travel, oxygen and vacuum gear might not be essential. But if the goal is to explore space or visit orbital locations, pawns will need Vacsuits and Vacsuit Helmets to survive. Additionally, installing Gravship Walls, Barriers, and Oxygen Pumps becomes necessary to maintain breathable environments in low-oxygen areas.

item.title: Rumor: A Nintendo Direct for July 2025 Could Be Happening Soon
item.description:
A Nintendo Direct dedicated to various Switch 2 titles could still happen in July, according to a known industry leaker and their sources. While Nintendo or its third-party partners have not confirmed a Nintendo Direct for this month, the leaker claimed that the broadcast could go live sometime after the launch of Donkey Kong Bananza .

Since its launch, the Switch 2 has become the hottest-selling gaming product of 2025, with an estimated five million units sold within its first month on the market. Although games exclusive to the Switch 2 have not been plentiful so far, the success of Nintendo's new console is largely due to the enhanced support that original Switch games, such as Poemon Scarlet and Violet and The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom , received via free and paid upgrades. Aside from Mario Kart World , one of the most anticipated summer titles for the Switch 2 is Donkey Kong Bananza , which is set to launch on Thursday, July 17.

While rumors about a summer Nintendo Direct have made the rounds since Summer Game Fest, a known leaker claims that the next Direct could still air soon. During his July 14 podcast episode, industry leaker NateTheHate stated that a Nintendo Direct planned for July may still go live after Donkey Kong Bananza hits store shelves. NateTheHate and co-host MVG discussed how third-party games like Elden Ring: Tarnished Edition and Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade could also bolster support for the Switch 2.

NateTheHate Says the Next Nintendo Direct Could Still Happen Later in July

About 32 minutes into the podcast, NateTheHate states that some developers he has spoken with have chosen not to reveal details about some upcoming game projects, lending credence to a potential Nintendo Direct being when those games will be properly shown. As of this writing, Nintendo has not revealed when the next Nintendo Direct will happen, so all rumors must be taken with a grain of salt.

Along with third-party game support, NateTheHate and MVG also talked about Nintendo titles that could carry the Switch 2 into the 2025 holiday season. While Pokemon Legends: Z-A will launch on October 16, the highly anticipated Metroid Prime 4: Beyond has no precise release date. Given that Metroid Prime 4: Beyond was first revealed during the June 2024 Nintendo Direct as a 2025 title, it stands to reason that an exact launch date for Samus' next adventure could be revealed at an upcoming Direct.

Currently, the only confirmed Nintendo-centric broadcast scheduled for this month is Pokemon Presents, which will air on Tuesday, July 22, at 9:00 AM Eastern. It remains to be seen if NateTheHate's Nintendo Direct prediction is correct.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Reveals New Skins for Psylocke and Loki
item.description:
Summary

  • New summer swimsuit skins for Psylocke and Loki are coming July 17 at 7 PM PDT in Marvel Rivals' shop.
  • A fresh team-up between Jean Grey and Wolverine is being criticized for making the Duelist more powerful than ever.
  • NetEase Games plans for its season 3.5 update to launch on August 8, adding Blade to Marvel Rivals' roster.

Marvel Rivals has given players their first look at new summer swimsuit skins for Psylocke and Loki, which will be making their official debut in the popular hero shooter's shop on July 17 at 7 PM PDT. NetEase Games recently released Season 3 of Marvel Rivals , adding the popular X-Men character Jean Grey to the roster as the Duelist Phoenix.

In addition to adding Phoenix herself, NetEase Games introduced a fresh team-up between the new Duelist and Wolverine in Marvel Rivals . The team-up has been met with quite a bit of controversy, as it powers up Wolverine's Feral Leap ability. Under the team-up, Feral Leap covers Wolverine in flames, allowing him to deal percentage damage to nearby foes. He also gains lifesteal, which means he is simultaneously dealing more damage than before and is constantly regenerating health. Many Vanguard players have complained about the team-up, claiming that it makes the Duelist completely unbalanced.

In a recent post on Twitter, NetEase Games gave players a first look at two new summer skins coming to Marvel Rivals on July 17 at 7 PM PDT. Psylocke's costume is called Breezy Butterfly and shows the Duelist in a teal swimsuit and a purple top. Meanwhile, Loki's upcoming costume is called Robe of Relaxation and shows the hero wearing green swim trunks and a matching robe with golden accents. From the image shown, he's also sporting a wide-brimmed hat and has a golden dragon draped across his shoulders. As of writing, NetEase Games hasn't revealed just how much either cosmetic will cost.

Marvel Rivals Showcases Summer Swimsuit Skins for Loki and Psylocke

NetEase Games teased the arrival of these summer costumes in the roadmap for Season 3 of Marvel Rivals , which included new skins for Thor and Luna Snow as well. The roadmap also gave players a first look at upcoming skins for Mister Fantastic, Invisible Woman, The Thing, and Human Torch, which will be modeled after their appearance in the upcoming MCU film The Fantastic Four: First Steps . As part of the collaboration, Human Torch and The Thing will be receiving a new team-up on July 25.

While Season 3 has only just begun, many players are already keeping an eye on the future, as NetEase Games revealed that its Season 3.5 update will be launching on August 8. The major mid-season update will add Blade to Marvel Rivals , a character who has been teased since the very beginning of Season 1. With a whole new season to enjoy and even more content just around the corner, many fans are feeling optimistic about the future of Marvel Rivals .

item.title: Persona 5: The Phantom X is Getting Review Bombed
item.description:
Some gamers are review bombing Persona 5: The Phantom X , claiming that the rewards for global players are not as good as the ones offered on Chinese servers. Like most gacha games, Persona 5: The Phantom X is filled with ways to get more currency to spend in-game without using real-life cash, but it seems that the developer may have dropped the ball with Western players.

Released in China and South Korea in 2024, Persona 5: The Phantom X only became available globally on June 26. Since its release, Persona 5: The Phantom X has been a huge hit, and the free-to-play gacha game even toppled Persona 5 Royal ’s peak player count on Steam. However, it seems that not all gamers are pleased with the new title.

As spotted by PC Gamer, Persona 5: The Phantom X is being review bombed, with the game currently boasting “Mixed” reviews on Steam, with only 49% of all players recommending it. The situation is even worse on the Google Play Store, where the RPG stands at only 2.1 out of 5 stars. The main reason for the review bombing is that gamers believe that global players are getting much worse rewards when compared to the Chinese version of the game, with some reviewers complaining that they are being treated like “second-hand citizens,” and vowing not to spend any money on the game until rewards are equal.

Players Review Bomb Persona 5: The Phantom X Over Differences in Rewards

As can be seen in a document created by a fan, the rewards for the gacha systems in Persona 5: The Phantom X are indeed not equal. Some unpopular differences include the fact that global players get only 100 gems for maintenance downtime, while Chinese gamers get 300. Some redemption codes were already offered to Chinese players, while none have been made available globally yet. Additionally, some new characters are not being added to the standard banner after their initial release, while this happens on the Chinese server.

It’s hard to tell why the developers of Persona 5: The Phantom X implemented these changes, but it could be linked to the pace of how quickly content is released globally. Last week, developer Black Wings Game Studio changed the global roadmap for Persona 5: The Phantom X , which would allow players outside of China to get caught up more easily.

Persona 5: The Phantom X ’s Update 1.1 was released for players in the West on July 10. It remains to be seen how these complaints will be addressed, though, and if Persona 5: The Phantom X will continue to be popular going forward.
